alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:31PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI...NORTHEASTERN CRITTENDEN...WESTERN TIPTON AND NORTHEASTERN SHELBY COUNTIES... At 531 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located near Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, moving northeast at 55 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Millington, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Munford, Brighton, Dixonville, Tipton, Atoka, Gilt Edge, Burlison, Garland, Barretville, Egypt, Griffin Corner, Quito, Redwood, Rosemark, Idaville, Locke, Beaver and Randolph. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
